p: Using advanced spectroscopic techniques, Indrianingsih et al. [ 86] isolated catechin, epicatechin, and tiliroside from Q. gilva. The tiliroside found in Q. gilva can inhibit α-glucosidase activity. Flavonoids are also found to be important bioactive compounds of Quercus leaves. Xu et al. [ 87] conducted a study on acorn leaves ( Quercus liaotungensis) and isolated one new flavonoid glycoside, namely, 2,3-diol acetonide-3- O- α-L-rhamnopyranoside-kaempferol, and 25 known polyphenolics. Recently, a study carried out on the infusion of the leaves of the six different species of Quercus revealed the presence of 7 flavan-3-ols, 2 flavonols, 18 flavonols/flavanone glycosides, 1 flavanone, 1 flavone, and 4 other unknown compounds. In this context, the presence of 4 procyanidin dimers in infusions was also documented [ 79].
